meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of gabbro.
meanings.sent1: The gabbroic rocks were dark and dense.
meanings.sent2: The kitchen countertop had a gabbroic appearance.
meanings.sent3: The gabbroic mountain seemed to frown at the hikers.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a gabbroic quality, deep and unyielding.
meanings.sent5: The gabbroic texture of the wall felt rough and cool to the touch.

meanings.sent1: The soil had a gabbroic composition, rich in minerals.
meanings.sent2: The artist painted a gabbroic landscape with dark hues.
meanings.sent3: The gabbroic clouds in the sky looked like giant boulders.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were as gabbroic as the stone he held in his hand.
meanings.sent5: The gabbroic scent of the earth after rain was refreshing and earthy.

meanings.sent1: The gabbroic formation was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent2: The building material was a mix of concrete and gabbroic elements.
meanings.sent3: The gabbroic statue stood tall in the town square.
meanings.sent4: Her necklace was made of gabbroic beads strung together.
meanings.sent5: The gabbroic structure of the bridge made it sturdy and durable.
